snippet: The group, which provided the provenance of a drawing sold in 1938, has faced criticism for its lack of transparency and success in tracing the owners of art in the Gurlitt collection.
abstract: German experts tasked with investigating art collection of Cornelius Gurlitt containing works possibly looted by Nazis claims it is making progress; leader of task force, criticized for secrecy and moving too slowly, cautions it may not be possible to determine provenance of every work.
lead_paragraph: The group, which provided the provenance of a drawing sold in 1938, has faced criticism for its lack of transparency and success in tracing the owners of art in the Gurlitt collection.

headline.main: German Panel Defends Effort to Trace Owners of Nazi-Looted Art
headline.print_headline: German Panel Cites Progress in Tracing Looted Art
